benchmark_details.name: AusLaw Citation Benchmark
benchmark_details.overview: The AusLaw Citation Benchmark is a real-world dataset comprising 55,005 Australian legal instances and 18,677 unique citations, aimed at evaluating legal citation prediction using various approach comparisons.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark for evaluating models on the legal citation prediction task and to establish a dataset to inspire future developments in this legal domain.

data.source: The NSW Caselaw section of the Open Australian Legal Corpus.
data.annotation: Manual checking of LLM-generated descriptions for quality assurance.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the model's prediction accuracy for citations.
methodology.interpretation: A higher accuracy indicates better performance in predicting the correct legal citations.
methodology.baseline_results: Cite-SaulLM-7B achieved an accuracy of 51.7% and Cite-LLaMA-3.1-8B achieved 46.2% accuracy.
methodology.validation: Benchmark validation through systematic testing across multiple LLM approaches and retrieval systems.
